attributes.action: When referring to our Debt state what we owe not what % it is of something else.
attributes.additional_details: A debt is “a sum of money owed” and should be referred to as such. There is no logical reason why Government should compare our National Debt to GDP (or anything else) other than to keep the truth from us of their out of control spending and borrowing (£619 ml every single day). It can only be done to deceive us once more.
attributes.background: Since 1947 our Debt increased from £25 bn to £1,547 bn but when comparing it to GDP Gov can claim it dropped 65% and they are able to conceal from us their borrowing of more than £2 bn every week for 10 years. See www.mrms.uk for many more alarming facts about the way Gov is running our Country.
